snippet: Fixing a hole in the ceiling; updating a kitchen in a stabilized unit; private use of a public area.
abstract: Real Estate Q & A on New York City laws and guidelines governing responsibility for repairs on a co-op unit, renovations to rent-stabilized apartments and use of public areas in condominium buildings. (M)
lead_paragraph: Fixing a Hole in the Ceiling QThe unoccupied co-op upstairs from me is being renovated, and the workers created a hole in my bathroom ceiling. Who is responsible for fixing it? I don't want the contractor working upstairs to work on my place. If I hire someone to fix it for me, am I entitled to a reimbursement?
